title: Mahindra Scorpio N, Classic waiting periods stretch up to nearly 2 months
description: The Mahindra Scorpio N and Scorpio Classic continue to be among the carmaker’s most popular offerings in the Indian market, and the waiting periods for these SUVs can extend up to nearly two months. Scorpio N Z8 Select variants’ waiting period is up to almost two months Other Scorpio N trims have waiting periods of up to one month Scorpio Classic’s waiting period is up to one month for both trims Mahindra Scorpio N variant-wise waiting period As per an official communication to Mahindra dealers, the Scorpio N’s entry-level Z2 (Rs 13.99 lakh-14.89 lakh) trim has a waiting period of up to one month for both petrol-manual and diesel-manual configurations; it’s the same for the Z4 (Rs 15.63 lakh-18.65 lakh), Z6 (Rs 17 lakh-18.69 lakh), Z8 (Rs 18.99 lakh-23.24 lakh) and Z8 L (Rs 20.69 lakh-24.69 lakh) variants. The Z8 Select (Rs 17.33 lakh-19.33 lakh) trim has the longest waiting period, climbing up to nearly two months. The S trim costs Rs 13.62 lakh for the 7-seat configuration and Rs 13.86 lakh for the 9-seat layout. The S11 only comes as a 7-seater, priced at Rs 17.34 lakh when equipped with captain seats and Rs 17.49 lakh with bench seats. In the Scorpio Classic, the unit produces 130hp and 300Nm of torque, whereas the Scorpio N outputs 175hp and up to 400Nm. The Scorpio Classic can only be had with a 6-speed manual gearbox, while the Scorpio N also offers a 6-speed torque converter. There is also the option of a 2.0-litre turbo-petrol engine on the Scorpio N; the unit develops 203hp and 370Nm and is paired with either a 6-speed manual or 6-speed torque converter transmission. The Scorpio N can also be equipped with 4WD in its higher variants. html:
Scorpio N's mid-spec Z8 Select variants command the longest waiting period.

The Mahindra Scorpio N and Scorpio Classic continue to be among the carmaker’s most popular offerings in the Indian market, and the waiting periods for these SUVs can extend up to nearly two months.

  1. Scorpio N Z8 Select variants’ waiting period is up to almost two months
  2. Other Scorpio N trims have waiting periods of up to one month
  3. Scorpio Classic’s waiting period is up to one month for both trims

Mahindra Scorpio N variant-wise waiting period

As per an official communication to Mahindra dealers, the Scorpio N’s entry-level Z2 (Rs 13.99 lakh-14.89 lakh) trim has a waiting period of up to one month for both petrol-manual and diesel-manual configurations; it’s the same for the Z4 (Rs 15.63 lakh-18.65 lakh), Z6 (Rs 17 lakh-18.69 lakh), Z8 (Rs 18.99 lakh-23.24 lakh) and Z8 L (Rs 20.69 lakh-24.69 lakh) variants. The Z8 Select (Rs 17.33 lakh-19.33 lakh) trim has the longest waiting period, climbing up to nearly two months.

Mahindra Scorpio Classic variant-wise waiting period

The waiting period details for the Scorpio Classic are quite straightforward, as it comes in only two trims – S and S11 – and both have a waiting period of up to one month. The S trim costs Rs 13.62 lakh for the 7-seat configuration and Rs 13.86 lakh for the 9-seat layout. The S11 only comes as a 7-seater, priced at Rs 17.34 lakh when equipped with captain seats and Rs 17.49 lakh with bench seats.

Mahindra Scorpio N and Scorpio Classic powertrain details

Both models utilise a 2.2-litre turbo-diesel engine, albeit in different states of tune. In the Scorpio Classic, the unit produces 130hp and 300Nm of torque, whereas the Scorpio N outputs 175hp and up to 400Nm. The Scorpio Classic can only be had with a 6-speed manual gearbox, while the Scorpio N also offers a 6-speed torque converter. There is also the option of a 2.0-litre turbo-petrol engine on the Scorpio N; the unit develops 203hp and 370Nm and is paired with either a 6-speed manual or 6-speed torque converter transmission. The Scorpio N can also be equipped with 4WD in its higher variants.
